channel.title: [Class suggestion] The chamberlain
channel.description:
>**The Chamberlain** Neutral support; unique **Passive ability: Regent** You may step forward as a royal to become king after the king has died. If you become king, you will become the regent king. **Night ability: Patronage** _(infinite uses, 1-day cool down)_ Grant your target access to treasury. They will gain a use of each of their abilities that has/had 2 or more uses. **Day ability: Adjust schedule** _(infinite uses, 1-day cool down)_ Add/subtract 30 seconds to the day's timer, your choice.
spawns in every game with a good or evil king, sometimes spawns in a neutral king game. Goal: If the original king is evil, win with blue dragon; if he is good, win with the unseen/cult. If he is neutral, then survive.
>**The regent king** Neutral special **Passive: Tenacity** Immune to occupation **Day ability: royal finger** (infinite uses) your next accusation of treason will count twice. **Day ability: Pass the torch** (1 use) Select a player to become the new king. You will step down and become the chamberlain again. **Night ability: Friends** (2 uses) determine your target's faction **Night ability: Guards!** (4 uses) send a guard to protect the target.
goal: same as the chamberlain's.
----------------
1) I wanted a class to balance out the king's alliance. 2) I thought the idea of a regent would be cool
NOTE: the chamberlain does not know what his allegiance is until the original king dies.

item.title: [Class suggestion] The chamberlain
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
ThePlex:

The Pass the Torch day ability isn’t good. It’s dangerous and can screw over a faction.

IE: Targetting Prince, Mastermind, Cult Leader, any power classes that exist.

Then you’re essentially confirming yourself, which isn’t good at all. No class should ever be able to solidly confirm themselves to everyone.

The whole point is to screw over a class. As evil, you can make prince king; as good, you can make the revived player king before they are converted, etc.

If you would like, i’ll make something to have him not confirmable.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion] The chamberlain
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
ThePlex:

Basically “you will become the neutral king” there’s little to no difference and there’s no point in creating a duplicate King class.

RopeStringFace:

No there is a difference rad the regent king

ThePlex:

So basically if you know who the Court Wizard or Hunter is, you just give them infinite of their limited abilities. They’re limited for a reason and shouldn’t be given more uses of any of them. Same goes for the scum classes.

-gives unlimited uses to hunter- -dies from bleeding-
yes, it is a powerful class.

ThePlex:

Such originality in your ideas, I can’t think of anywhere I’ve seen this ability.

it’s not like it is all that wild an idea. I have had the idea of affecting the timer with a sorcerer class by changing weather for a while.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion] The chamberlain
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
I Said until afterwards. If she is neutral then just try to stay King for the whole game or something

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion] The chamberlain
item.dc:creator: Frostwolf103
item.description:
I think that reveals to everyone when you suddenly revert back to original role.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion] The chamberlain
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
But you could also force a MM to be king. Plus they don’t know you are regent king or not until afterwards.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion] The chamberlain
item.dc:creator: ThePlex
item.description:
Not if you wanna survive.

As soon as people realize that you can essentially force a Prince to become King, you’ll get executed. That’s why people are hesitant to execute the FoL cowardly king.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion] The chamberlain
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Don’t you sometimes WANT to screw over a faction? And revealing yourself is a downside.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion] The chamberlain

item.description:
The Pass the Torch day ability isn’t good. It’s dangerous and can screw over a faction.

IE: Targetting Prince, Mastermind, Cult Leader, any power classes that exist.

Then you’re essentially confirming yourself, which isn’t good at all. No class should ever be able to solidly confirm themselves to everyone.

item.title: [Class suggestion] The chamberlain
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Your point about the regent king isn’t valid. The regent king has some very important differences from a normal king.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion] The chamberlain
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
It’s mostly good now. Some of the base classes abilities are weird but someone else already commented on that

item.title: [Class suggestion] The chamberlain
item.dc:creator: ThePlex
item.description:
RopeStringFace:

The Chamberlain

Neutral support; unique

Passive ability: Regent

You may step forward as a royal to become king after the king has died. If you become king, you will become the regent king.

Basically “you will become the neutral king” there’s little to no difference and there’s no point in creating a duplicate King class.

RopeStringFace:

Night ability: Patronage

(infinite uses, 1-day cool down) Grant your target access to treasury. They will gain a use of each of their abilities that has/had 2 or more uses.

So basically if you know who the Court Wizard or Hunter is, you just give them infinite of their limited abilities. They’re limited for a reason and shouldn’t be given more uses of any of them. Same goes for the scum classes.

RopeStringFace:

Day ability: Adjust schedule

(infinite uses, 1-day cool down) Add/subtract 30 seconds to the day’s timer, your choice.

Such originality in your ideas, I can’t think of anywhere I’ve seen this ability.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion] The chamberlain
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
Frostwolf103:

Another question, so if player like yourself manage to become regent king but then you decide to pass the torch to someone and this king is either BD or Unseen/Cult, do you have to re-do the winning condition to lynch the new selected king again in order to win or is this fullfilled already and just survive?

RopeStringFace:

Goal: If the original king is evil, win with blue dragon; if he is good, win with the unseen/cult

keyword: original

your goal is dependent on the ORIGINAL king only.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion] The chamberlain
item.dc:creator: Frostwolf103
item.description:
This role is always hostile with good/evil king except for the neutral one, yes?

Another question, so if player like yourself manage to become regent king but then you decide to pass the torch to someone and this king is either BD or Unseen/Cult, do you have to re-do the winning condition to lynch the new selected king again in order to win or is this fullfilled already and just survive?

item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
NuclearBurrito:

Besides, owhy use pass the torch if you don’t know who is on your side?

One strategy I thought of was as evil chamberlain to pass on the title of king to the prince, so he can’t execute or jail any more.

Another as neutral king (or any king) would be to give it to the NK in the end game.

NuclearBurrito:

Why even be king when that just makes you a target?

More votes, gives you guards

Read full topic
